page.title: 06TOURISM & TRANSPORT TREDIS
page.content: Some of the old farm labourers' cottages have been converted into holiday accommodation,and are let to families on a weekly basis in the summer. There are no official caravan or camping sites in this area, but many of the farmers allow caravans and short-stay campers,and there is some catering for overnight accommodation. Most tourists arrive by car, which leads to occasional congestion on narrow roads.Access by rail is not possible,as the nearest station is at St. Germans,approximately four miles from Downderry.Presently there is no public service link from the station to the villages and hamlets,but recent Government legislation and community pressure could result in the provision of a minibus link service between the major transport undertakings.
